resources.string: Encourage the person to support the injury with their hand, or use a cushion or items of clothing to prevent unnecessary movement. As soon as possible, call 999 or get someone else to do it. Continue supporting the injury until help arrives.

Think FAST. Face: is there weakness on one side of the face? 
 Arms: can they raise both arms?
 Speech: is their speech easily understood? 
Immediately call 999 or get someone else to do it.

Establish what they have taken.
 When? And how much?
 if possible gargle with extra salty water to vomit out poison.
 As soon as possible, call 999 or get someone else to do it.
 Do not make the person sick.
Cool the burn under cold running water for at least ten minutes.\n Loosely cover the burn with cling film or a clean plastic bag.\n If necessary, call 999 or get someone else to do it.
Put pressure on the wound with whatever is available to stop or slow down the flow of blood.\n As soon as possible, call 999 or get someone else to do it.\n keep pressure till help arrives.

Check breathing by tilting their head backwards and looking and feeling for breaths.
 Call 999 as soon as possible, or get someone else to do it.
 Push firmly downwards in the middle of the chest and then release.
 Push at a regular rate until help arrives.
